sections.heading: The seven rules for settling disputes: Removal in the presence, removal through mindfulness, removal through non-confusion, removal according to what they have admitted, removal through “a mark of seeking offenses,” removal by asking many, and removal by spreading grass.
The dhammas and anudhammas are as explained in detail above in the bhikkhu rules.
The explanation of the bhikkhunī pātimokkha is finished.
